Class BlockedQ

  • java.lang.Object
    • BlockedQ

  • public class BlockedQ
extends java.lang.Object
    This class was written last year in CS120 by myself (some of it was probably Ted Wendt but I don't recall) and was modified to work for Oranges and implement synchronization and blocking
    Author:
    Andrew Johnson and Theodore Wendt

      constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BlockedQ

        public BlockedQ()
        constructor. Sets back and front node to null.

    • Method Detail

      • enqueue

        public void enqueue(Orange newEntry)
        this puts an Orange into the queue. If the size of the queue is 1, it will wake up functions who are waiting for an orange to be enqueued. This method is synchronized to prevent race conditions.
        Parameters:
        newEntry - An orange which should be enqueued.
        See Also:
        enqueue(Orange)

      • dequeue

        public Orange dequeue()
        This takes an orange from the queue. If the queue is empty, the thread attempting to access this will block (wait), and be notified when the first orange is enqueued.
        Returns:
        An orange from the queue.
        See Also:
        enqueue(Orange)

      • getFront

        public Orange getFront()
        helper method for dequeue() method
        Returns:
        the data that the front node points to
        See Also:
        dequeue()

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        This method simply checks if the front node is null. If so, the queue is empty.
        Returns:
        boolean which is true if queue is empty

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        number of Oranges in the queue
